title: Research Associate in PET Methods
text:
Faculty / Organisational unit : Medical & Human Sciences School / Directorate : Institute of Population Health Division : Centre for Imaging Sciences Employment type : Fixed Term Duration : Until 30 November 2016 Location : Wolfson Molecular Imaging Centre Salary : £30,434 to £37,394 per annum Hours per week : Full time 
We are looking for a full-time Research Associate to join the University’s joint CRUK/EPSRC Cancer Imaging Centre with the University of Cambridge to work on a specific work package looking at the characterization of genetic and biological tumour heterogeneity using imaging biomarkers, focusing on Positron Emission Tomography (PET) methods. You will develop and evaluate methods to improve the information obtained from cancer PET scans through the application of model based image reconstruction. 
The contract is initially available until 30 November 2016, with a possibility of an extension for two years to 30 November 2018. 
An excellent team player with a PhD or equivalent experience, you will be expected to work closely with other research staff. The position offers excellent opportunities for networking and training, both within Manchester and with the University of Cambridge. You will be expected to attend and contribute to various meetings and summer schools. 
The Institute of Population Health is committed to promoting equality and diversity, including the Athena SWAN charter for promoting women’s careers in STEMM subjects (science, technology, engineering, mathematics and medicine) in higher education. The Institute received a Bronze Award in 2013 for their commitment to the representation of women in the workplace and we particularly welcome applications from women for this post. Appointment will always be made on merit. For further information, please visit http://www.mhs.manchester.ac.uk/about-us/athena/ . Enquiries about the vacancy, shortlisting and interviews: 
Dr Julian Matthews, Senior Lecturer in Imaging Sciences
